net.truelicense.core

Class TrueLicenseApplicationContext<Model>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.truelicense.core.TrueLicenseApplicationContext<Model>
  • Type Parameters:
    Model - the type of the repository model.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    RepositoryContextProvider<Model>, CodecProvider, CompressionProvider, LicenseApplicationContext, LicenseFactory, LicenseManagementAuthorizationProvider, CachePeriodProvider, ClassLoaderProvider, Clock, PasswordPolicyProvider, PasswordProtectionProvider<ObfuscatedString>, BiosProvider
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    V1LicenseApplicationContext, V2LicenseApplicationContext

    public abstract class TrueLicenseApplicationContext<Model>
extends Object
implements BiosProvider, CachePeriodProvider, ClassLoaderProvider, Clock, CodecProvider, CompressionProvider, LicenseApplicationContext, LicenseManagementAuthorizationProvider, LicenseFactory, PasswordPolicyProvider, PasswordProtectionProvider<ObfuscatedString>, RepositoryContextProvider<Model>
    A basic license application context. This class is immutable.

    Unless stated otherwise, all no-argument methods need to return consistent objects so that caching them is not required. A returned object is considered to be consistent if it compares equal or at least behaves identical to any previously returned object.

    Author:
    Christian Schlichtherle

    • Constructor Detail

      • TrueLicenseApplicationContext

        public TrueLicenseApplicationContext()

    • Method Detail

      • authentication

        public Authentication authentication(AuthenticationParameters parameters)
        Returns an authentication for the given key store parameters.

        The implementation in the class TrueLicenseApplicationContext returns a new Notary for the given key store parameters.

        Parameters:
        parameters - the key store parameters.

      • authorization

        public final LicenseManagementAuthorization authorization()
        Returns the license authorization.

        The implementation in the class TrueLicenseApplicationContext returns an authorization which clears all operation requests.

        Specified by:
        authorization in interface LicenseManagementAuthorizationProvider

      • bios

        public BIOS bios()
        Returns the BIOS.

        The implementation in the class TrueLicenseApplicationContext returns a StandardBIOS.

        Specified by:
        bios in interface BiosProvider

      • cachePeriodMillis

        public long cachePeriodMillis()
        Returns the cache period for some intermediate results in milliseconds. Any non-negative value is valid. Return Long.MAX_VALUE to disable the timeout or zero to disable the caching of intermediate results.

        The implementation in the class TrueLicenseApplicationContext returns half an hour (in milliseconds) to account for external changes to the configured store for the license key.

        Specified by:
        cachePeriodMillis in interface CachePeriodProvider

      • classLoader

        public final Optional<ClassLoader> classLoader()
        Returns the optional class loader. If no value is present then the system class loader gets used to load classes and resources.

        The implementation in the class TrueLicenseApplicationContext lists the current thread's context class loader, if not null.

        Specified by:
        classLoader in interface ClassLoaderProvider

      • context

        public final LicenseManagementContextBuilder context()
        Description copied from interface: LicenseApplicationContext
        Returns a new license management context builder.
        Specified by:
        context in interface LicenseApplicationContext

      • encryption

        public abstract Transformation encryption(EncryptionParameters parameters)
        Returns a password based encryption using the given parameters.
        Parameters:
        parameters - the password based encryption parameters.

      • now

        public final Date now()
        Returns a new representation of the current date/time. A basic implementation could just return a new Date. However, in order to protect against date/time forgery, a more sophisticated implementation should use an authoritative time source, e.g. a radio clock, an Internet time server or extrapolate an approximation from timestamps in input data. If resolving the current date/time from an authoritative resource fails for any reason, the implementation should simply fallback to return a new Date.

        The implementation in the class TrueLicenseApplicationContext returns a new Date.

        Specified by:
        now in interface Clock

      • pbeAlgorithm

        public abstract String pbeAlgorithm()
        Returns the name of the default Password Based Encryption (PBE) algorithm for the license key format. You can override this default value when configuring the PBE.
        See Also:
        EncryptionInjection.algorithm(java.lang.String)

      • policy

        public PasswordPolicy policy()
        Returns the password policy.

        The implementation in the class TrueLicenseApplicationContext returns a new MinimumPasswordPolicy.

        Specified by:
        policy in interface PasswordPolicyProvider

      • protection

        public final PasswordProtection protection(long[] obfuscated)
        Returns a password protection for the given representation of an obfuscated string. Calling this method creates a new ObfuscatedString from the given array and forwards the call to protection(ObfuscatedString).

      • protection

        public final PasswordProtection protection(ObfuscatedString os)
        Returns a password protection for the given password specification.

        The implementation in the class TrueLicenseApplicationContext returns a new ObfuscatedPasswordProtection.

        Specified by:
        protection in interface PasswordProtectionProvider<ObfuscatedString>

      • storeType

        public abstract String storeType()
        Returns the name of the default key store type, for example "JCEKS" or "JKS". You can override this default value when configuring the key store based authentication.
